-Remove your workspace.
-Create a remote project(e.g sample payroll project)
-Build the project
-Select executable,then ->Edit Configurations->C/C++ Debug Application
-click on buttons "New", "Apply", "Debug"
A "launch Configuration Error" Dialog Box appears. See the log below.
NOTE: If eclipse is shutdown,restarted and debug attempted again without
removing workspace(i.e. project and executable were created in previous session)
then no exceptions occur.

Repository used to be more like Project in that it implements the interface for 
members().  That function is used to get a list of IResources back.  We used to 
follow this more rigidly when we used Repository in the Navigator.  Now, because 
we don't (and can't) use the Navigator to show remote projects, we don't care 
all that much about the members function.  Currently the members function will 
create a bunch of ResourceElements for the resource DataElements, but they don't 
really get maintained (i.e. if an element is added, we don't listen and add a 
corresponding ResourceElement).   The findFile API assumes we're searching a 
project without any differentiation from local projects and thus uses the 
members call to get at it's contents.   Because Repositories aren't maintaining 
these resources, they don't get added when new files get added.  We are moving 
away from using remote IResources the same way as local resources, so we need to 
work with elements directly instead.  I've added a separate findFile call for 
remote projects that works against elements instead of resources.   This seems 
to solve the problem here.
